p: Experimental insects consisted of sterile male C. capitata obtained from the Programa Moscamed mass rearing facility in El Pino, Guatemala. Flies were irradiated as pupae two days prior to eclosion with 95 Gy of gamma radiation from a 60Co source. Irradiated pupae were shipped initially to the USDA-APHIS Medfly Project in Sarasota, FL, USA, and then to the USDA-ARS Subtropical Horticulture Research Station (SHRS) in Miami, FL, USA. Flies were reared using established protocols [ 44, 47] and used in bioassays when sexually mature (5â€“10 days old).
